Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper Class Reference

Detailed Description

Class to maintain relationships between containers, data grids and text boxes in order to layout controls dynamically.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.LayoutHelper ( UserControl  view,
StackPanel  panel,
DataGrid  grid 
)

Constructs a LayoutHelper to manage a view's dynamic layout.

Parameters:
viewThe container for the view/screen
panelThe stack panel that contains the grid and contains layout information such as the margin. Not necessarily the first level parent, should be the stack panel that uses the StackPanelStyle.
gridThe data grid to manage

This sample shows how to call the LayoutHelper constructor. 

            class View : UserControl 
            {
                LayoutHelper layoutHelper;

                void View()
                {
                    layoutHelper = new LayoutHelper(this, xamlStackPanel, xamlDataGrid);
                }
            }
Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.LayoutHelper ( UserControl  view,
StackPanel  panel,
DataGrid  grid,
DataPager  pager 
)

Constructs a LayoutHelper to manage a view's dynamic layout.

Parameters:
viewThe container for the view/screen
panelThe stack panel that contains the grid and contains layout information such as the margin. Not necessarily the first level parent, should be the stack panel that uses the StackPanelStyle.
gridThe data grid to manage
pagerThe grid's data pager

This sample shows how to call the LayoutHelper constructor. 

            class View : UserControl 
            {
                LayoutHelper layoutHelper;

                void View()
                {
                    layoutHelper = new LayoutHelper(this, xamlStackPanel, xamlDataGrid, xamlDataPager);
                }
            }

Member Function Documentation

void Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.AssignTotalBoxToColumn ( string  header,
TextBox  textbox 
)

Associates a DataGrid Column with a TextBox in order to track the position of the column and dynically move the text box accordingly.

Parameters:
headerThe string that is displayed in the column header. This value cannot be null or empty.
textboxThis textbox to associate, this should be located in a canvas horizontally aligned with the grid in order for the layout algorithm to work properly.

This sample shows how to call the AssignTotalBoxToColumn method. 

            class View : UserControl 
            {
                void View()
                {
                    LayoutHelper layoutHelper = new LayoutHelper(this, xamlStackPanel, xamlDataGrid);
                    layoutHelper.AssignTotalBoxToColumn("Column Header", xamlTextBox);
                }
            }
void Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.Pause ( )

Pause dynamic layout.

void Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.RenameHeader ( DataGridColumn  column,
string  newHeader 
)

Updates the text shown in the column header and maintains the relationship with the text box associated with the column.

Parameters:
columnThe column to rename. The Header property must be of type string and cannot be null empty.
newHeaderThe new text for the column header. This value cannot be null empty.

This sample shows how to call the RenameHeader method. 

            class View : UserControl 
            {
                LayoutHelper layoutHelper;

                void View()
                {
                    layoutHelper = new LayoutHelper(this, xamlStackPanel, xamlDataGrid);
                }

                private void OnLoadingRow(object sender, DataGridRowEventArgs e)
                {
                    layoutHelper.RenameHeader(xamlDataGrid.Columns[2], "New Column Header");
                }
            }
void Intel.Finance.Costing.Portal.Infrastructure.Control_Helpers.LayoutHelper.Start ( )

Start dynamic layout.
